message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.MM

The paper discusses the use of network measurements to monitor and detect the throttling of internet connectivity as a mechanism of censorship in Iran. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it involves the manipulation of network traffic to restrict access to information. It also involves network infrastructure (cs.NI) as the authors propose using network measurements to monitor connectivity. The paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cybercrime (cs.CY), social and information networks (cs.SI), and multimedia (cs.MM) as it discusses the impact of censorship on the consumption and distribution of multimedia content and the use of social media platforms.
